Help for choosing the right settings: Help for choosing the right settings
The format of your new subtitles. SRT is: The format of your new subtitles. SRT is the most common format and is supported by most video players.
Before exchanging the subtitles with the: Before exchanging the subtitles with the new ones, the program will pause so that you can edit them. The program continues after pressing <Enter> in the console.
You can save the images that make up the: You can save the images that make up the old subtitles. This can be useful if you want to compare the old and new subtitles. They are stored in a directory where this program is installed.
You can keep the original video files. T: You can keep the original video files. This way you can test different settings.
Keep a copy of the old subtitle files:: Keep a copy of the old subtitle files:
You can save the original subtitle files: You can save the original subtitle files. This way the program does not need to extract them again if you run the program again.
Keep a copy of the new subtitle files:: Keep a copy of the new subtitle files:
You can save the new subtitle files. Thi: You can save the new subtitle files. This way you can easily edit them later.
Use different languages for some subtitl: Use different languages for some subtitles:
help.language: Here you can tell the program to use a different language for some languages. This can be useful if the English subtitles contain letters like ä, ö or ü. Then you could use the German language because it contains all letters of the English language + these special letters. Changes are seperated by a new line and follow this format: "old language" -> "new language" (e.g. eng -> ger).
help.brightness: You can change the maximum allowed difference in brightness in the text color. This can be useful because some subtitle images are more noisy than others. The value should be as low as possible but the text in the images should not be too thin.
Version {latest_version} is available. D: Version {latest_version} is available. Do you want to download it?
Error #{error_code}: {error}\nDo you wan: Press Enter to continue with the next file...
No files selected. Please select at leas: No files selected. Please select at least one file.
The subtitles are ready for editing. The: The subtitles are ready for editing. They can be found at {sub_dir}. Press OK when you are done.
Select a file from the left list: Select a file from the left list
Language \"{new_lang}\" is not installed: Language "{new_lang}" is not installed, using "{lang_code}" instead
Language \"{lang_code}\" is not installe: Language "{lang_code}" is not installed, using English instead
The subtitles are ready for editing. Pre: You can now edit the new subtitle files. Press OK when you are done.
